title: Snow causes disruption across south of England - BBC News
summary: man dies and two in hospital after two a34 crashes .
a34 closed both ways between the a303 and the a343 until evening .

documents.title: van driver killed in crash with lorry
text: van driver killed in crash with lorry

documents.title: good evening
text: that 's it for today , but bbc south live will start earlier than usual tomorrow at 06:00 to make sure you get all the latest news .
more snow is expected and amber warnings are in place , so stay safe and keep warm .

documents.title: oxford mini plant closed for workers
text: the mini plant in oxford has cancelled its night shift as a result of the bad weather .
the plant told workers not to turn up this evening .

documents.title: 100 vehicles stuck on puddletown bypass
text: about 100 vehicles are believed to be stuck on the a35 puddletown bypass in dorset , police have said .
the force said it wanted to send a message of reassurance to all of those involved on the closed stretch of road between bere regis and the stinsford roundabout .

ch insp alan setchell of dorset police said : `` i would make a special plea to anyone who has a particular urgent medical need or requires immediate assistance to contact us on 101 and give us your precise location so we can assist you as a priority .
`` people are urged to stay in their vehicles and we will get to you as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: evening headlines in berkshire
text: evening headlines in berkshire
author: Michael Race
BBC South

documents.title: 'snow canoeing ' in bere regis
text: two men have been spotted `` snow canoeing '' in rural dorset .
a bbc cameraman filmed the pair as they were towed by a 4x4 through the streets of bere regis .

documents.title: south western railway 'pre-cancels ' trains
text: here 's the latest statement we have from south western railway as snow continues to affect the rail network .
more snow is forecast across much of the south western network on thursday and friday .

we are working hard with network rail to keep passengers on the move and unfortunately will need to pre-cancel some trains on both days to help deliver as reliable a service as possible in these challenging conditions . ''

documents.title: one-hour delays for oxford bus company services
text: service update : services are currently running with an average of 1 hour delays .
are your buses going to run tomorrow morning ?

documents.title: chiltern railways services still in action
text: chiltern railways continues to operate all its routes but said some services may be delayed `` due to severe weather conditions '' .
the company said this is likely to be the case for the rest of the day , and possibly into tomorrow .
all travel restrictions are being restricted for the day .

documents.title: power back on in parts of berkshire
text: power supplies in parts of berkshire have been restored after a substation exploded .
sse told bbc berkshire that 400 homes across wokingham , barkham and finchampstead were without power following a small explosion at a substation .
earlier , 1,400 homes were left in the dark following the incident .
sse spokesman duncan mcdonald apologised to customers and confirmed all power had been restored .

documents.title: a34 remains closed after fatal crash
text: closures on the a34 will remain in place `` until further notice '' following a fatal crash this morning , police have said .
hampshire police released a statement this evening confirming work to repair barriers near the tot hill services is ongoing .
earlier it said highways england hoped to have closures lifted by 18:00 .
the northbound closure runs from bullington cross to tot hill , and the southbound closure runs from tot hill to burghclere .
a 46-year-old man from southampton died in a crash involving a van and a lorry .

documents.title: police close road for sledging
text: after sledgers on athelstan road in southampton helped a police car get up the hill , the officers helpfully closed the road allowing the sledging to continue .
apparently , they 're hoping for some success in the beijing winter olym in 2022 .
thanks to phil wilkinson for sending in the

documents.title: severe weather website created for oxford
text: oxford city council has created a severe weather webpage .
it will be posting updates on its services including gritting , rubbish collections and bus services .
you can find it here .

documents.title: snowboarding in dorchester
text: nathan jefferies has found the quickest way to get about today - he 's been snowboarding down dorchester high street .

documents.title: weather forecast for thursday evening and friday
text: here 's the all-important weather forecast for thursday evening , into friday .

documents.title: dorset police receives 300 calls in 30 minutes
text: we 're currently experiencing exceptionally high demand into our control room with over 300 calls in the past 30 minutes .
please only call us if there is danger to life or a crime in progress .
for non urgent enquiries , please visit the website at :

documents.title: tractor pulls ambulance up hill in dorset
text: the bad weather has led to some hospitals in dorset cancelling routine clinics and appointments .
ambulances have also struggled to transport patients , and a tractor has been spotted helping one get up preston road , outside weymouth .

documents.title: newbury rape investigation 'complex '
text: det ch insp matt stone of thames valley police has called the investigation into the rapes of two women in newbury as `` complex '' .
the attacks on 19 january , and more recently on saturday , appear to have been perpetrated by a taxi driver , or a man pretending to be one .
det ch insp matt stone said hundreds of hours of cctv were being reviewed , and `` painstaking forensic work '' under way .
deputy local policing area commander lindsey finch said there would be high visibility patrols in the town , and she urged people to only use licensed taxis .
a 40-year-old man from newbury was arrested on monday on sus of both rapes and has been released under investigation .

documents.title: fieldfares enjoying the snow ( and apples )
text: anthony morris has sent us these stunning shots of fieldfares enjoying apples in a farmoor garden in oxfordshire today .

documents.title: road closures in dorset
text: major routes closed in dorset include the a338 northbound out of bournemouth , the a354 at dorchester and the a350 .

documents.title: patient appointments cancelled at dorset hospitals
text: this has been a difficult day for the hospitals in dorset , and for their patients .
the royal bournemouth was the first to cancel routine clinics and appointments for both today and tomorrow , saying they did not want to put patients at risk getting to and from the hospital .
by mid-afternoon poole had followed suit and dorset county hospital also announced some cancelled appointments .
cancer care , urgent treatments and of course a & e services have continued as usual .
tomorrow more problems are expected , with all three hospitals hoping that as many staff as possible will make it in to work .
meanwhile in southampton , we 're getting reports that ambulances ca n't get into the hospitals because of the conditions of the roads .
author: David Fenton
Health Correspondent, BBC South

text: all sports in the city council 's parks and open spaces will be cancelled this weekend due to the weather conditions .

documents.title: bournemouth university closes campuses
text: bournemouth university says it is closing its campuses `` effective immediately '' until monday morning because of the weather .
planned lectures and exams will not take place .

`` we have been reviewing local advice and alerts on the adverse weather conditions and in particular the snow and high winds that are expected to create hazardous conditions in the next 24 hours , '' a spokeswoman said .

documents.title: police investigate berkshire taxi rapes
text: two rapes in newbury by taxi drivers are believed to be linked , thames valley police has said .
the first incident involved a woman in her 20s who was raped in the early hours of 19 january .
she got in the car at mayors lane .
the second incident was on saturday , after a 29-year-old woman got into a taxi near the roundabout at inches yard at about 04:20 and was later raped .
the driver was described as asian , about 5ft 8in , in his 30s , slim , with a strong asian accent .

documents.title: traffic stationary heading out of southampton on a35 westbound
text: we 're on the a35 heading out of southampton - it 's basically stationary at the junction with the m271.ubhjy
it 's very difficult and very slow and of course the longer you sit , the more snow comes down , the harder people find it to get going .
many cars just have n't got the grip to get anywhere on even the slightest incline .
getting out of southampton towards the new forest is very difficult at the moment .
author: Tim Atkinson
BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: breakingpower cut hits hundreds in oxford
text: engineers are trying to restore power to hundreds of homes in the oxford area .
scottish and southern electricity networks says 700 customers are affected .
it does not know what 's caused the outage , or if it is weather related .
they expect it to be restored by 22:00 .

documents.title: train delays continue across the south
text: south western railway says services may be cancelled or delayed by up to one hour or revised as weather disruption continues .
its network is suffering a series of problems including isolated train faults , a broken-down freight locomotive and an obstruction on the track at winchfield .
the operator is expecting delays to continue until the end of the day and is advising passengers to check its website for updates .
elsewhere , london paddington has reopened but the number of services is reduced .
southern says services on its network may be cancelled or delayed by up to 15 minutes .

documents.title: gridlocked roads out of southampton
text: main routes out of southampton now all gridlocked # beastfromtheast

he says conditions are `` getting tricky '' for drivers in the area .
getting tricky driving in centre of southampton now

documents.title: bournemouth unused school meals help charities
text: more than 1,500 unused schools meals have been given to charities in bournemouth after schools closed due to the snow .
meals provider forerunner appealed on local media to avoid the `` tonne of food '' going to waste .
the mediterranean chicken with penne pasta , salad and apple crumble and custard dishes was donated to eight local charities .
we were n't sure we were even going to get our own delivery of food today so this has really helped us out .
it 's allowed us to give lunch and dinner for 24 people - our cook was over the moon .
author: Edward Sault
BBC South Today

documents.title: rspca call-outs increase in snowy weather
text: the rspca says it is being `` stretched to the limit '' by the current adverse weather conditions .
the charity has received 300 % more calls than usual , with officers dealing with cases such as horses collapsed in the snow , a cygnet trapped in ice and a cat stranded on a snow-covered roof .
rspca superintendent simon osborne said : `` with the bad weather hitting large sections of england and wales we are taking a huge amount of calls from members of the public concerned about animals .

`` we are very busy with animal rescues up and down the country and will get to as many of the incidents as we can - but we are only able to respond to emergencies at the moment and we must also consider the safety of our officers in severe weather conditions . ''

documents.title: hospital appointments cancelled in dorset
text: dorset hospitals have been affected by the snow and ice in the region , with some non-urgent appointments being cancelled .

royal bournemouth and christchurch hospitals said : `` cancer and urgent work will be continued wherever possible however the presumption will be for routine procedures , outpatient clinics and diagnostic appointments this afternoon and tomorrow will be postponed . ''
poole hospital said it was postponing all routine procedures this afternoon and tomorrow .
dorset county hospital said : `` the hospital is extremely busy at the moment and regrettably we have had to postpone some appointments and planned operations . ''

a spokesman said : `` they 've been working to fix barrier damage following the fatal collision and ensure the road is safe . ''
northbound it 's closed from bullington cross to tot hill , southbound from tot hill to burghclere .

documents.title: police were aware of poundland killer before attack
text: crucial information may not have been shared about a paranoid schizophrenic who went on to murder a man in a poundland in abingdon , an inquest has heard .
trevor joyce ( killed justin skrebowski with a knife from the shop in abingdon , oxfordshire , on 7 december 2015 .
trevor joyce was on the radars of thames valley police and the nhs before the attack , oxford coroner 's court heard today .
supt rory freeman told the court : `` we were aware of his behaviour .
i do n't think we really understood his complex mental health needs .
`` we could have been more connected and coordinated .
at every point with mr joyce we should have been doing something . ''
when asked if there was a deficit in communication from nhs mental health services , he said `` communication does n't appear to be at the level i would have expected '' .
author: Jeremy Stern
BBC South Today

documents.title: handy winter driving tips
text: with snow falling across the region , here are five handy hints to driving in snow and ice .
frank bird , from highways england , has some advice for driving in bad weather .

the a34 will remain closed for some time .

documents.title: ferrari crash victim 's family dealing with 'tragic loss '
text: the family of alexander worth , the 13-year-old boy who died after a £ 1.2m ferrari flipped over in north warnborough , hampshire , have released a statement following the trial of matthew cobden , who was found guilty of causing death by careless driving .

they said : `` the outcome of this trial will not bring alexander back but we hope the media coverage has in some way increased awareness of the fragility of life and the danger of driving powerful cars for however short a journey and the necessity of adhering to all sensible safety measures .
`` we ask for the family 's privacy to be respected whilst we continue to come to terms with the tragic loss of our very special boy . ''

documents.title: channel islands to uk fast ferry services cancelled
text: condor liberation 's sailings tomorrow have been cancelled due to the forecast showing wave heights and wind speeds `` above safe operating limits for high speed craft '' .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: conditions 'horrendous ' before fatal a34 crash
text: it was in the rush hour this morning that a van travelling south was struck by a lorry which was heading north and crashed through the central barrier after hitting some ice .
the driver of the van was killed and his passenger seriously injured .
it brought the road to a complete halt leaving drivers stranded for several hours while police tried to get them away from the crash scene .
in a second crash , while police were dealing with the first incident , a lorry was pushed into the barriers protecting the supports of a road bridge over the a34 .
these really were horrendous conditions - at the time of the initial crash the temperature of the road surface was -7c .
that means as fast as the grit goes down , the road freezes , leaving it extremely dangerous .
author: Joe Campbell
BBC South Today

documents.title: south western railway issues weather travel warning
text: travel advice please be aware that the met office has issued a `` red '' weather warning for exeter and the surrounding area .
if you are travelling between basingstoke , exeter , salisbury please travel as early as you can as the weather may cause additional disruption .
some information would be useful please .
delayed '' does n't tell us much

14:27 from clapham j to pinhoe .

surprised your running trains in this weather its just going to get worse the rest of the day and over night .

people need to get home .
personally if there was a code red 'risk to life ' i would stay at home they should n't be running the trains
unfortunately the red warning was issued after 8am , a lot of people wo n't have seen it until far too late .
i can part accept that however this is 8 hours later
i hope that once people saw it , they headed for home pronto !
@ twitterid happy days , we are rolling !
should arrive home just around the time the pub opens .
go safe out there kids .
# devonsnow # propersnow

documents.title: snow coming down hard across southampton
text: there 's been fairly heavy snow in the city for a few hours now .
the main routes are still just about passable but the side roads are pretty treacherous .
up to 20cm of the white stuff has been forecast for the area .
author: Michael Stoddard
BBC South

the centre says shoppers can check websites and social media feeds for more information .

text: oxford united 's match at home to fleetwood has been postponed due to the weather .
the fixture will now be played on tuesday 10 april .

documents.title: ferrari driver and passenger were not wearing seatbelts
text: matthew cobden , of walton-on-thames , surrey , and alexander worth were both not wearing seatbelts at the time of the crash .
it happened on an access road between newlyns and lodge farms on 22 august 2016 .
during his trial , mr coben apologised in court for not asking the boy to wear a seatbelt .
the jury heard he offered alexander a ride in the ferrari when the teenager visited his car storage business with his mother and her partner .
the supercar flipped after hitting a fence post , throwing both alexander and mr cobden from the vehicle .

documents.title: breakingfatal ferrari crash driver guilty
text: the driver of a £ 1.2m ferrari involved in a crash that killed a 13-year-old boy has been found guilty of causing his death .
alexander worth , from kings worthy , hampshire , died in august 2016
businessman matthew cobden , 39 , was found guilty of causing death by careless driving at winchester crown court .
his trial heard he believed there was a fault with the ferrari f50 causing a sudden increase in power when he touched the accelerator .

documents.title: cotswold wildlife park in the snow
text: cotswold wildlife park in the snow

documents.title: pitch inspection at kassam
text: oxford united are holding a pitch inspection at the kassam stadium this at 15.30 gmt to see if saturday 's game against fleetwood can go ahead .
the league has sent a referee to come and examine how the playing surface has coped with the cold weather .
the club says they have been covering the pitch since last thursday to try and protect it from the freezing temperatures .
# oufc oxford united to hold a pitch inspection at 3.30pm this afternoon to see if game against fleetwood can go ahead .

documents.title: reading schools closed tomorrow
text: reading borough council has listed the schools and nurseries which will be closed tomorrow .
so far , they are :

documents.title: weather : very cold with significant snow into tonight
text: the latest forecast for the south of england as snowfall is set to increase throughout this afternoon .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: how to keep warm in the snow
text: this calf at post green farm , lytchett minster , dorset , has found one way to stay out of the snow - by hiding in a hay-filled feeder .

documents.title: snow ca n't stop whispering bob
text: due to the bad weather , bbc radio 2 presenter bob harris is unable to leave his house in oxfordshire .
so instead of travelling to wogan house in london he 'll be broadcasting tonight 's edition of bob harris country from a shed at the bottom of his garden .
bob said : i could n't let my listeners down , so luckily we 've been able to work out a way to make sure that bob harris country gets through . ''
his show will be on air tonight from 19:00 to 20:00 .

documents.title: watch penguins enjoying the snow live
text: from this well-situated camera you can watch a live feed of cotswold wildlife park 's penguins .
here they are ( see pic above ) having a rather good time in the snow .

documents.title: new oxford owner gives manager search update
text: new oxford united owner sumrith `` tiger '' thanakarnjanasuth has told fans the search for a new manager at the club is `` well advanced '' .
mr thanakarnjanasuth took over the league one club on monday from outgoing chairman darryl eales and has already had conversations with some `` very strong candidates '' .
the u 's have been without a permanent manager since sacking spaniard pep clotet in january .
derek fazackerley and chris allen will continue to lead the team for saturday 's league match at home to fleetwood ( weather permitting of course !
author: Adam Williams
BBC Sport

documents.title: giving out hot food to help the homeless in southampton
text: alexandra pearson has taken her mobile food van - deli on your doorstep - to southampton 's bargate to give out hot food and sandwiches to homeless people in the city centre .
she normally sells at offices and workplaces in the city , but decided to help out the homeless and vulnerable when she saw what the weather was like this morning .
i felt i needed to do my bit and if i could help out and make someone 's day , then all the better for it .
we 've got burgers , sausages , hot dogs , pizzas , lots of yummies and cakes and chocolates .
they can come along and help themselves . ''
author: Hannah Bewley
Reporter, BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: red jet and hovertravel suspend cross-solent services
text: the wind on the solent is still creating adverse conditions and our service remains suspended .
we are updating our dedicated services status hotline 01983 717717 hourly and both our website & app provide real-time information .
red jet suspended until further notice due to adverse weather .
next review will be the 13:45 sailing from southampton .
we apologise for the inconvenience caused to your journey

documents.title: a34 to stay closed until this evening
text: the a34 is closed both ways between the a303 and the a343 near bullington cross after two crashes earlier .

a hampshire constabulary spokesman said : `` we have been working hard with our colleagues in the emergency services and highways to ensure those stuck in traffic get away safely and that the road is reopened as quickly as possible .
`` all those who were caught up in the incident have now been able to drive away from the scene .
`` however , due to extensive damage to the barriers and their location , our colleagues from highways england have informed us that the road is expected to be closed until this evening . ''

text: man charged over six-hour stand off

documents.title: silk city to headline bestival friday night
text: silk city have been announced as the headliners for friday night at bestival this year .
more acts for the four-day event at the lulworth estate in dorset , which takes place between 2-5 august , will be announced in the coming weeks .
for @ twitterid friday night headliner i 've booked something you 'll never have seen in europe or probably the world .
two of the best party-starting djs back to back ladies and gents , boys and girls , please welcome @ twitterid and @ twitterid aka @ twitterid to the stage !

so excited for this
excited !
sorry pal i used to love the festival but this year is a serious decline .

documents.title: man charged after six-hour stand off in bournemouth
text: a man has been charged after a six-hour stand-off at a house in bournemouth last month .
specialist firearms were called to reports of a women being held hostage by an armed man in parley road early on 3 february .
she was found outside the property and was uninjured .
a man remained inside and a cordon was put in place while police dealt with the incident .
a loaded crossbow and two weapons , believed to be imitation firearms , were seized by officers
a 42-year-old man from watford has been charged with false imprisonment , arson , possession of a firearm , criminal damage and drugs possession .

documents.title: breakingman dies in a34 crash
text: at 07:18 today a lorry and a van crashed on the southbound carriageway of the a34 , two miles before the tot hill services .
the driver of the van , a 46-year-old man , from southampton , was pronounced dead at the scene .
his front seat passenger was taken to the john radcliffe hospital , oxford .
his injuries are described as life-changing .

documents.title: bournemouth university closes due to snow
text: bournemouth university has said both its campuses will be closed from 14:30 .
a decision about whether to open tomorrow will be made later .
campus closure : bu 's campuses will be closed from 2.30pm today , please read our story for more information .
we will provide further updates about tomorrow as soon as is practicable :

documents.title: fire reported at basingstoke station
text: there have been reports of a train fire at basingstoke station , which happened just after 11:00 .
services are heavily delayed but running .
there have been no reports of any injuries .

documents.title: four hundred berkshire homes without power
text: sse has told bbc berkshire that 400 homes across wokingham , barkham and finchampstead are without power following a small explosion at a substation.earlier , 1,400 homes were left in the dark following the incident.sse spokesman duncan mcdonald apologised to customers and said a hot food van was on its way to the affected areas.he added affected customers could expect to be without power until around 15:30 gmt .

text: snow and ice shuts paddington station

documents.title: concerns for missing reading woman
text: police are appealing for help tracing a woman who is missing from hospital in reading .
ashleigh fair , 19 , was last seen leaving the royal berkshire hospital at about 09:30 .
she was wearing a green and pink knitted jumper , black tracksuit bottoms and pink socks .
investigating officer , detective sergeant emily evans , said : we are very concerned for ashleigh 's wellbeing .
she is vulnerable and unwell , and we are also concerned that she is not wearing appropriate clothing for the weather . ''

documents.title: weymouth postman braves snow in shorts
text: kev park was snapped this morning bravely delivering the post , despite the arctic conditions , and - some might say - rather inappropriate attire .

documents.title: expect up to 20cm of snow in parts of the region
text: the met office is predicting 10-20cm of snow in its amber warning zone .
the area includes the isle of wight , dorset and areas west of southampton in hampshire .
up to 5cm of snow is likely in the yellow area .

documents.title: trapped a34 cars 'released in half an hour '
text: hampshire constabulary has got a gritter lorry to the scene of the a34 crash and is starting to release traffic stuck in the tailbacks .
the closures are still in place , but a spokeswoman said they expect everyone stuck in the queues to be out in about half an hour .

documents.title: a34 still closed both ways
text: update : lane one nb # a34 now safe thanks to gritter lorry , now releasing stuck traffic .
closures still in place nb & sb & will be for some hours so please avoid area .
really tough conditions out there today , as you can imagine , so thanks for your patience as we deal with this .
which section of the a34 ?
it 's a long road , glad i 'm not out and about today .
hi norman - there is a full closure on the a34 nb at bullington cross and sb at the a343 .
thanks

documents.title: breakingthree in hospital after a34 crashes
text: three people have been taken hospital , one of whom has life-changing injuries , after two crashes on the a34 this morning , south central ambulance service says .
on the southbound collision , between a lorry and a van , they took two patients , one with serious injuries , to the john radcliffe hospital , oxford .
on the northbound collision , between two lorries , they took one patient with serious and life-changing injuries to the same hospital .
four ambulances , two rapid response vehicles , the hampshire & isle of wight air ambulance , and a full hazardous area response team ( hart ) were deployed .

text: closure announcement : unfortunately , due to extreme weather conditions , the park will be closed today ( thursday 1st march ) .

totterly understandable .
thank you alex - we 're keeping a close eye on # stormemma and will post all updates on twitter , our website & facebook page stay safe in this freezing weather .
oh no the otters will be cold
hi joe .
our robust family of otters are well equipped for this weather .
otters have two layers of fur consisting of a thick , coarse , waterproof outer coat and an insulating , warm inner layer made up of much finer , softer fur .
why they even do that ?

documents.title: breakingpaddington station : train service resumes
text: paddington station has now partially reopened with a reduced service in operation , network rail says .
a reduced timetable will be operating and passengers are being advised to check before they travel .
